Bad move. much better is Qe2.
moves.13... Kd7: Both queens are now on a rampage. Whoever does the most damage now wins.
moves.14. Qxg7 Qxb1+ 15. Ke2 Qc2+ 16. Ke1 Rxb8: Black maintains a constant check, preventing White from gaining any material.
moves.18... Qxc4+ 19. Ke1 Bc8 20. Qxh7 Qc1+ 21: The rook comes into play, signalling the beginning of the end.
moves.22. Kf3 Qc3+ 23. Kf4 Qxd4+ 24. Kg3: Better is Qe4. It stops the bleeding, even if an exchange does not help White materially.
moves.24... Qxf2+ 25. Kh3 Qxg2+ 26. Kh4 Qxh1: At this point, it's all but over.
moves.27. Qd3+: White's only hope is to harass Black with constant checks.
moves.27... Ke8 28. Qg6+ Kf8 29. Qf5+: The absolute end. White strays too close to the bishop.
